news_header: Asha de Vos, a Sri Lankan marine biologist, transformed her childhood fear of the ocean into a passion for marine conservation, focusing on the unique blue whale population near Sri Lanka.
news_text: Asha de Vos, a prominent Sri Lankan marine biologist, shifted her childhood fear of the ocean into a deep passion for marine conservation after witnessing blue whales in tropical waters, which led her to discover that they are a distinct nonmigratory subspecies. She has dedicated her career to studying these whales and advocating for ocean conservation while also working to educate her fellow Sri Lankans about the ocean's importance. De Vos founded the Sri Lankan Blue Whale Project and the nonprofit Oceanswell, aiming to inspire love for the ocean and promote marine education. Despite facing skepticism and criticism, she has become a leading figure in marine biology in Sri Lanka.
